meanings.definition: To use force in order to move or open something.
meanings.sent1: She had to prise open the jammed door with all her strength.
meanings.sent2: He carefully used a tool to prise the lid off the paint can.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to prise open the nut but couldn't manage.
meanings.sent4: The detective tried to prise information from the suspect during the interrogation.
meanings.sent5: The old lock was so rusty that it took a lot of effort to prise it open.

meanings.definition: To extract or obtain something with effort.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist had to prise the ancient artifact from the ground gently.
meanings.sent2: She managed to prise some useful information from the old documents.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to prise the toy from the dog's mouth without getting bitten.
meanings.sent4: He had to prise himself away from the comfortable couch to go to work.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to prise the secret recipe from the retired baker.

meanings.definition: To value or estimate something highly.
meanings.sent1: She would always prise her grandmother's advice above all others.
meanings.sent2: He would often prise the opinions of experienced sailors when at sea.
meanings.sent3: The teacher would prise creativity in her students above all else.
meanings.sent4: The company would always prise innovation in their employees.
meanings.sent5: The community would prise generosity and kindness in its members.
